metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20481 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
XRef::getEntry in XRef.cc in Poppler 0.72.0 mishandles unallocated XRefentries, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULLpointer dereference) via a crafted PDF document, when XRefEntry::setFlag inXRef.h is called from Parser::makeStream in Parser.cc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20481` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: poppler package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11').
